meta.title: AI Readiness and Implementation Assessment
meta.description: Comprehensive 60-question evaluation of institutional readiness for AI integration across governance, pedagogy, technology, culture, and team dynamics

domains.name: Strategic Leadership & Vision
domains.description: Institutional commitment, leadership support, and strategic planning for AI integration

domains.name: Governance & Policy
domains.description: Policies, procedures, and governance structures for responsible AI use

domains.name: Pedagogy & Learning
domains.description: Integration of AI into teaching, learning, and curriculum development

domains.name: Technology Infrastructure
domains.description: Technical capabilities and infrastructure to support AI initiatives

domains.name: Culture & Change Management
domains.description: Organizational culture, faculty/staff readiness, and change management processes

domains.name: Team Dynamics & Collaboration
domains.description: Team collaboration, cross-functional cooperation, and collective AI adoption

domains.name: Mission, Strategy & Student Success Alignment
domains.description: How well AI initiatives map to institutional mission, strategic plan, values, and student success outcomes

questions.question: How would you characterize your institution's current AI strategy?

options.label: We have a comprehensive, board-approved AI strategy with clear goals and timelines
We are actively developing an AI strategy with stakeholder input
We have had initial discussions about AI strategy but no formal plan
Individual departments are exploring AI informally
We have not yet developed an AI strategy

questions.question: What level of leadership support exists for AI initiatives?

options.label: Strong, visible support from president/chancellor and board
Moderate support with some resource allocation
Cautious support with limited commitment
Neutral stance with no clear position
Resistance or skepticism from leadership

questions.question: Describe your institution's specific AI vision and how it aligns with your overall strategic plan.
questions.placeholder: Please provide details about your AI vision, key objectives, and how it connects to institutional priorities...

questions.question: How does your AI strategy align with your institution's Quality Enhancement Plan (QEP) or strategic initiatives?

options.label: AI strategy is fully integrated with QEP and strategic planning processes
Some alignment with broader strategic initiatives
Informal connections to institutional priorities
AI is treated as a separate, standalone initiative
No consideration of alignment with institutional strategy

questions.question: What budget allocation exists for AI initiatives?

options.label: Dedicated multi-year budget with clear allocation across departments
Annual budget allocation for AI projects
Project-by-project funding approval
Individual departments funding AI from existing budgets
No specific budget allocation for AI initiatives

questions.question: What are the biggest strategic challenges your institution faces in AI adoption?
questions.placeholder: Describe the primary obstacles, concerns, or barriers that impact your AI strategy...

questions.question: How are AI success metrics and KPIs defined at your institution?

options.label: Comprehensive KPIs across student success, efficiency, and innovation
Basic metrics for usage and adoption
Metrics defined for pilot programs only
Informal tracking of outcomes
No defined success metrics for AI initiatives

questions.question: What is your institution's approach to AI risk management?

options.label: Comprehensive risk assessment framework with mitigation strategies
Basic risk assessment with documented concerns
Informal consideration of AI risks
Minimal awareness of potential risks
No formal risk consideration for AI initiatives

questions.question: How does your institution approach AI vendor partnerships and procurement?

options.label: Strategic partnerships with clear evaluation criteria and due diligence
Structured procurement process with vendor assessment
Basic evaluation of AI vendors and tools
Ad hoc decisions based on immediate needs
No formal process for AI vendor selection

questions.question: Describe your institution's competitive positioning regarding AI compared to peer institutions.
questions.placeholder: How do you view your AI readiness relative to similar institutions? What advantages or gaps do you see?

questions.question: What is your institution's timeline for AI implementation milestones?

options.label: Detailed timeline with specific milestones and deadlines
General timeline with key phases identified
Rough estimates for major AI initiatives
Flexible approach without specific deadlines
No established timeline for AI implementation

questions.question: What role do you envision AI playing in your institution's future (3-5 years)?
questions.placeholder: Describe your long-term vision for AI integration across academics, operations, and student services...

questions.question: What AI governance policies does your institution currently have in place?

options.label: Comprehensive AI policies covering ethics, privacy, academic integrity, and usage guidelines
Basic AI policies addressing key areas with regular updates
Draft policies under review by governance committees
Currently discussing what policies are needed
No formal AI policies in place

questions.question: How does your institution address AI ethics and responsible use?

options.label: Established ethics framework with regular training and compliance monitoring
Developing ethics framework with stakeholder input
Basic ethical guidelines for AI use
Informal discussions about AI ethics
No formal ethics framework for AI

questions.question: Describe your institution's approach to AI transparency and explainability requirements.
questions.placeholder: How do you ensure AI decisions can be understood and explained to stakeholders?

questions.question: How does your institution handle data privacy and security for AI applications?

options.label: Comprehensive data governance framework with AI-specific protocols
Existing data policies adapted for AI use cases
Basic guidelines for AI data handling
Relying on general institutional data policies
No specific data governance for AI

questions.question: What governance structure oversees AI initiatives?

options.label: Dedicated AI governance committee with cross-functional representation
Existing IT or academic committee with AI oversight
Informal working group or task force
Individual administrator or department oversight
No formal governance structure for AI

questions.question: How are academic integrity concerns addressed with AI tools?

options.label: Comprehensive academic integrity policy updated for AI era
Updated guidelines addressing AI in academic work
Faculty have discretion with some institutional guidance
Informal discussion without formal policy updates
No updates to academic integrity policies for AI

questions.question: What compliance and regulatory considerations does your institution face regarding AI?
questions.placeholder: Describe any FERPA, accessibility, accreditation, or other regulatory requirements that impact your AI governance...

questions.question: How does your institution approach AI bias prevention and detection?

options.label: Comprehensive bias detection and mitigation protocols
Basic awareness with some preventive measures
Informal consideration of bias issues
Minimal awareness of bias concerns
No formal consideration of AI bias

questions.question: What is your institution's approach to AI audit and compliance monitoring?

options.label: Regular audits with documented compliance procedures
Periodic reviews of AI usage and compliance
Ad hoc monitoring when issues arise
Minimal oversight of AI implementations
No formal monitoring or audit procedures

questions.question: How does your institution handle AI-related intellectual property and data ownership issues?
questions.placeholder: Describe policies around AI-generated content, data rights, and intellectual property considerations...

questions.question: How well-established are your institution's AI incident response procedures?

options.label: Comprehensive incident response procedures with clear escalation paths
Basic procedures for handling AI-related issues
Informal response protocols
Ad hoc handling of issues as they arise
No established incident response procedures

questions.question: How is AI currently integrated into teaching and learning at your institution?

options.label: Widespread, strategic integration across multiple disciplines with faculty support
Pilot programs in select departments with positive outcomes
Individual faculty members experimenting with AI tools
Limited awareness with minimal implementation
No formal integration of AI in pedagogy

questions.question: What support exists for faculty to learn about and implement AI in their teaching?

options.label: Comprehensive professional development, resources, and ongoing support
Regular training sessions and workshops available
Occasional workshops or seminars offered
Informal peer-to-peer sharing and learning
No formal support for faculty AI learning

questions.question: Describe specific examples of how AI is being used to enhance student learning outcomes.
questions.placeholder: Provide concrete examples of AI applications in courses, assignments, or learning experiences...

questions.question: How is AI being used to enhance student advising and support services?

options.label: AI integrated into advising systems with predictive analytics
Pilot programs using AI for student support
Exploring AI options for advising enhancement
Limited awareness of AI potential in advising
No implementation of AI in student services

questions.question: What AI tools are being used for curriculum development and assessment?

options.label: AI integrated into curriculum mapping, assessment design, and learning analytics
AI used selectively for specific curriculum or assessment tasks
Experimental use by individual faculty or departments
Considering AI options for curriculum work
No use of AI in curriculum development or assessment

questions.question: What challenges do faculty face in adopting AI tools for teaching and learning?
questions.placeholder: Describe the primary obstacles, concerns, or barriers faculty encounter when trying to use AI...

questions.question: How are learning outcomes and student success being measured with AI integration?

options.label: Comprehensive learning analytics with AI-driven insights
Basic tracking of AI impact on student performance
Measurement in pilot programs only
Relying on anecdotal evidence of impact
No systematic measurement of AI impact on learning

questions.question: How is AI being integrated into online and hybrid learning environments?

options.label: Advanced AI integration with personalized learning paths and adaptive content
Basic AI features in learning management systems
Pilot testing AI tools in select online courses
Considering AI options for online learning
No AI integration in online learning environments

questions.question: How do you envision AI changing the role of faculty and instructors in the future?
questions.placeholder: Describe how AI might transform teaching roles, responsibilities, and the faculty-student relationship...

questions.question: What is your institution's approach to AI literacy for students?

options.label: Comprehensive AI literacy curriculum across disciplines
Dedicated courses and modules on AI literacy
AI literacy content integrated into existing courses
Optional workshops or seminars on AI
No formal approach to AI literacy education

questions.question: How does your institution address accessibility and inclusion in AI-enhanced learning?

options.label: Comprehensive accessibility standards with AI-specific considerations
Basic compliance with accessibility requirements
Building awareness of accessibility needs
Minimal consideration of accessibility in AI implementations
No specific approach to AI accessibility

questions.question: What innovative AI applications in education is your institution most excited about exploring?
questions.placeholder: Describe emerging AI technologies or applications you're considering for future implementation...

questions.question: How does your institution approach research involving AI in education?

options.label: Active research programs studying AI in education with published outcomes
Pilot studies and small-scale research projects
Collaborating with other institutions on AI education research
Informal exploration and data collection
No formal research on AI in education

questions.question: How would you assess your institution's technology infrastructure for AI implementation?

options.label: Advanced infrastructure with cloud computing, high-performance systems, and AI-ready platforms
Adequate infrastructure with some cloud services and modern systems
Basic infrastructure that could support simple AI applications
Limited infrastructure requiring significant upgrades
Inadequate infrastructure for AI implementation

questions.question: What AI tools and platforms are currently available to your campus community?

options.label: Enterprise AI platforms with institutional licenses and support
Selected AI tools available to faculty and students
Pilot implementation of specific AI tools
Individual users accessing AI tools independently
No institutional AI tools available

questions.question: Describe your institution's current technology stack and how it supports or limits AI implementation.
questions.placeholder: Include details about cloud services, data systems, networking, security infrastructure, and integration capabilities...

questions.question: What is your institution's approach to AI vendor evaluation and selection?

options.label: Systematic vendor evaluation with security, pedagogy, and integration criteria
Structured review process with multiple stakeholders
Basic evaluation focusing on cost and features
Ad hoc selection by individual departments
No formal vendor evaluation process

questions.question: How robust is your data infrastructure for AI analytics and insights?

options.label: Advanced data warehouse with integrated systems and real-time analytics
Adequate infrastructure with some integrated data sources
Basic infrastructure with siloed data systems
Limited infrastructure requiring significant integration work
Inadequate infrastructure for meaningful AI analytics

questions.question: What level of IT support exists for AI implementation and maintenance?

options.label: Dedicated AI/ML team with specialized expertise
IT staff trained in AI technologies and support
IT staff learning AI technologies as needed
Relying primarily on external vendor support
No specialized support for AI technologies

questions.question: What are the primary technical challenges your institution faces in AI implementation?
questions.placeholder: Describe infrastructure limitations, integration issues, security concerns, or other technical barriers...

questions.question: How does your institution approach AI system integration with existing technologies?

options.label: Strategic integration with comprehensive API management and data flow
Planned integration with documented interfaces
Basic integration for essential functions
Minimal integration with standalone AI tools
No systematic approach to AI system integration

questions.question: What is your institution's approach to AI system scalability and performance?

options.label: Enterprise-grade scalability with load balancing and performance optimization
Planned scalability with growth considerations
Basic scaling capabilities for current needs
Limited scaling with potential bottlenecks
No systematic planning for AI system scalability

questions.question: How does your institution plan to evolve its technology infrastructure to support future AI innovations?
questions.placeholder: Describe planned upgrades, emerging technologies you're considering, and your technology roadmap...

questions.question: How does your institution handle AI system monitoring and maintenance?

options.label: Comprehensive monitoring with automated alerts and performance dashboards
Basic monitoring with manual checks and maintenance schedules
Reactive maintenance when issues are reported
Primarily vendor-managed with limited internal oversight
No formal monitoring or maintenance processes

questions.question: How receptive is your campus culture to AI adoption?

options.label: Highly receptive with enthusiasm and proactive adoption
Moderately receptive with growing interest
Cautiously open with some concerns
Resistant with significant concerns and skepticism
Highly resistant with strong opposition

questions.question: How does your institution approach change management for technology initiatives?

options.label: Systematic change management with clear communication and support
Structured process with stakeholder engagement
Informal process with some planning
Ad hoc approach with limited planning
No formal change management process

questions.question: What cultural barriers or resistance points have you encountered regarding AI adoption?
questions.placeholder: Describe specific concerns, fears, or resistance you've observed from faculty, staff, or students...

questions.question: How is faculty development around AI being approached?

options.label: Comprehensive faculty development program with ongoing support
Regular professional development opportunities available
Occasional workshops or conference attendance
Faculty pursuing AI learning on individual initiative
No formal faculty development around AI

questions.question: What is the student response to AI integration in their learning experience?

options.label: Enthusiastic adoption with students requesting more AI integration
Generally positive response with growing comfort
Mixed response with varying levels of comfort
Cautious acceptance with some resistance
Significant resistance or concerns from students

questions.question: How does your institution communicate about AI initiatives to stakeholders?

options.label: Comprehensive communication strategy across all stakeholder groups
Regular updates through multiple channels
Periodic communication about major AI initiatives
Limited communication, primarily to internal stakeholders
No formal communication strategy for AI initiatives

questions.question: How do you envision transforming your institutional culture to embrace AI innovation?
questions.placeholder: Describe your strategy for cultural change, addressing concerns, and building enthusiasm for AI...

questions.question: How well do cross-functional teams collaborate on AI initiatives?

options.label: Excellent collaboration with regular communication and shared goals
Good collaboration with structured coordination
Moderate collaboration with some communication challenges
Limited collaboration with siloed efforts
Poor collaboration with frequent conflicts or miscommunication

questions.question: Describe the composition and effectiveness of your AI implementation teams.
questions.placeholder: Who is involved in AI initiatives? How do teams coordinate? What roles and responsibilities exist?

questions.question: How does your institution handle knowledge sharing about AI across departments?

options.label: Systematic knowledge sharing with documented best practices and regular forums
Regular sharing through meetings and collaborative platforms
Informal sharing through personal networks
Limited sharing with information staying within departments
No systematic approach to AI knowledge sharing

questions.question: What is the level of AI expertise distribution across your teams?

options.label: AI expertise well-distributed across multiple departments and roles
Growing distribution with training and hiring initiatives
Expertise concentrated in specific departments or individuals
Limited expertise with heavy reliance on external consultants
Minimal internal AI expertise

questions.question: What team-based challenges have you encountered in AI implementation?
questions.placeholder: Describe coordination issues, skill gaps, communication problems, or other team-related obstacles...

questions.question: How effectively do your teams adapt to new AI tools and technologies?

options.label: Highly adaptive with quick adoption and effective utilization
Moderately adaptive with structured learning approaches
Slow adaptation requiring significant support and training
Resistant to change with preference for existing tools
Very resistant with significant barriers to adoption

questions.question: AI initiatives are explicitly tied to institutional strategic priorities (e.g., equity, completion, innovation).

options.label: Not at all
Somewhat
Mostly
Fully

questions.question: Faculty/staff perceive AI tools as supporting  not conflicting with  pedagogical values.

options.label: Strongly disagree
Disagree
Agree
Strongly agree

questions.question: AI projects include KPIs aligned to student success metrics (persistence, equity gaps, learning outcomes).

options.label: Never
Sometimes
Often
Always

questions.question: Ethical AI principles reflecting institutional values have been formally adopted and operationalized.

options.label: Not started
Drafted
Adopted
Operational

maturity_levels.name: Initial/Ad Hoc
maturity_levels.description: Limited awareness and informal approaches to AI

maturity_levels.name: Developing
maturity_levels.description: Growing awareness with some planning and pilot efforts

maturity_levels.name: Defined
maturity_levels.description: Structured approach with documented processes and support

maturity_levels.name: Managed
maturity_levels.description: Well-managed AI initiatives with institutional support

maturity_levels.name: Optimized
maturity_levels.description: Comprehensive, strategic AI integration across the institution
